# Eigenvalues of a Normal Matrix

```{r}
set.seed(23)
M <- 4
# Generate matrix
P <- RM_normal(M, mean = 6, sd = 3, symm = F)
# Look at the eigenvalues
spectrum(P)
# Simulate
sim <- mixtime_sim(P, B = 50, steps = 30, epsilon = 0.2)
# Get arrays
batch <- sim[[1]]
evolved_batch <- sim[[2]]
```

```{r}
hist_mixtime(batch)
```

```{r}
s1 <- mixtime4d(batch)
if(bool_plot){  
  s1[[1]]
  s1[[2]]
  s1[[3]]
  s1[[4]]
}
```

```{r}
s2 <- scatter_6d(batch)
if(bool_plot){  
  s2[[1]]
  s2[[2]]
  s2[[3]]
  s2[[4]]
  s2[[5]]
  s2[[6]]
}
```


```{r}
data <- T
set.seed(23)
# Generate a random matrix
P <- RM_normal(M = 4, mean = 0, sd = 5, symm = T)
# Analyze the simulated matrix
if(!data){
  sim <- mixtime_sim(P, B = 1000, steps = 50, epsilon = 0.01)
  write_csv(sim[[1]], "batch1.csv")
  write_csv(sim[[2]], "evolved_batch1.csv")
  # Get arrays
  batch <- sim[[1]]
  evolved_batch <- sim[[2]]
} else{
  batch <- read_csv("batch1.csv")
  evolved_batch <- read_csv("evolved_batch1.csv")
}
```

```{r}
hist_mixtime(batch)
mixtime4d(batch)
```
